title: What are the "European mandalas" and how do they relate to Jung's concept of the collective unconscious?
first_phrase: In this text, Jung talks about the "European mandalas" and their connection to archetypes of the collective unconscious. He explains that the more conscious barriers a person has, the more powerful the unconscious forces and images will appear to them. He warns that if a conscious personality cannot recognize the nature of these archetypes, they may become possessed by them. The solution is for individuals to integrate their unconscious contents into their lives through a process called individuation, which results in a complete and integrated personal identity known as the "Self".

last_phrase: In summary, recognizing and integrating the vital unconscious contents is essential for the process of individuation, leading to the development of one's integral personality, also known as the "Self". This process is commonly represented in mystical and initiatic teachings, as well as alchemical symbolism. By accepting this, we can embark on a journey to a more complete and fulfilling sense of self.
